text: FEU Diliman, also known as FERN College, is an educational institution member of the Far Eastern University (FEU) Group of Schools. It is a non-stock, non- profit educational institution at Sampaguita Avenue, Mapayapa Village, Diliman, Quezon City. It was founded in 1994 to commemorate the birth centennial of Dr. Nicanor B. Reyes Sr., the founder and first president of the FEU.http://www.feu.edu.ph/manila/index.php/about/the-feu-story-the-feu-story- the-feu-story/ The campus was originally constructed for the Institute of Technology in the 1970s.Other FEU Campuses FEU Diliman is the home of the FEU Diliman Baby Tamaraws, the high school varsity team of the Far Eastern University. The Institute offers degree courses and started offering elementary and secondary education in the 2000s. == History == In March 2018, the school's operations management was turned over to East Asia Computer Center, Inc. (EACCI), the corporation managing FEU Institute of Technology (FEU Tech). Prior to this, FERN College had been operated by the Nicanor Reyes Education Foundation (NREF). The shift is particularly advantageous for the school's move to espouse the Business-IT Fusion concept. ==FEU Diliman Sports Center== The FEU Diliman Sports Center was officially inaugurated in 2014. The sports center was built to be the home of the FEU varsity teams. It houses the administrative and support services for varsity sports including the Athletics Office, the Team Confence Room, Athletes’ Dorm, Shower and Locker Rooms, Therapy Room, Team Tambayan and a Trophy Room.FEU Diliman Launches Top-Class Sports CenterFEU Diliman unveils new sports center ==References== Category:Educational institutions established in 1994 Category:Elementary schools in Metro Manila Category:Universities and colleges in Quezon City Category:University Athletic Association of the Philippines Category:Far Eastern University
title: Far Eastern University Diliman
